group_1.narration: My family teaches [textRed:the Kashin-style]@of ikebana flower arranging.
Kashin-style ikebana has a long history,@dating back over three hundred years.
Though not well-known, we have kept@our traditions for many generations.
However, one day my father fell deathly ill.@This caused some unusual circumstances.

group_1.textCenter: You don't have to worry about a thing,@Sensei. Leave the Kashin school to us...

group_1.narration: As I was still too young, some of his@best pupils ran the school instead.
That was when their reign of terror began...
Eventually, the most skilled pupil@was named as head of the school.
He ignored our traditions for the@sake of gaining fame.
More students came, but the Tokiwa@family lost everything to him.
My father died of his illness...and despair.@Then my relatives took me in.

group_1.textLeft: On his deathbed, my father told me@over and over...
Free the Kashin school of its false@master and set things right...
That was the duty given to me...@To avenge the Tokiwa family.

group_1.textRight: Wow...@You've had a really hard time, too...

group_1.textLeft: That's right around when I met our@little friend...

group_1.textRight: Witches are creatures that bring disaster@to the world.

group_1.textLeft: And what I wished for was...
...the power to avenge my family with@my own two hands.
Yes... The ability to know exactly who@caused the ruin of the Tokiwa family.
I am going to avenge my family, no@matter what.
...But it would be no use if I went after@the wrong people.
I was suspicious at first.@Was a Witch really behind all this?
That was why I wanted the power to@evaluate who my enemies really were.

group_1.textRight: So, in other words...@How do I say this...?
You have something like a radar?

group_1.textLeft: Well...@That's one way to put it, anyway.
If you put it simply, then yes.
